poem:
The Morning Politics

In the stark morning light  
newsprint crinkles,  
voices—like sparrows—  
flit about healthcare's  
unaddressed tree.  
Democrats firm,  
roots digging deeper—  
a stand against  
the withering bill.  
Yet daily, the sun  
uncaring rises,  
casting shadows,  
lengthening the silence  
over an unanswered call.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Top House Democrats vow to oppose shutdown bill over healthcare funding As House Republican leaders move to hold a vote on legislation to reopen the US government, top Democrats vowed on Tuesday to oppose the bill for not addressing their demand for more healthcare funding. Democrats have for weeks demanded that any measure to fund the government include an extension of tax credits for Affordable Care Act health plans, which were created under Joe Biden". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Top House Democrats vow to oppose shutdown bill over healthcare funding As House Republican leaders move to hold a vote on legislation to reopen the US government, top Democrats vowed on Tuesday to oppose the bill for not addressing their demand for more healthcare funding. Democrats have for weeks demanded that any measure to fund the government include an extension of tax credits for Affordable Care Act health plans, which were created under Joe Biden
